content: crochet mooncup by ariadne aranea as you can see this is not an exact replica of the real thing but it s not bad you will need a small amount of 4-ply cotton yarn in blood red and in a light / off-white yarn colour a 2mm hook a yarn needle and some snippy scissors abbreviations please note the stitches are in american that means e g single_crochet in the pattern means double crochet in british terminology i know this is perverse but i ve learned patterns primarily from us websites so there you are chain = chain st= stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch uk single_crochet single_crochet = single_crochet uk double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet uk treble_crochet decrease = decreasing i e working one stitch over the next two stitches n times = work the stitches in square brackets n number of times instructions 1 using red yarn ch2 5 single_crochet in second chain from hook 2 2 single_crochet in each stitch 10 stitches 3 1 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next stitch 5 times 15 stitches 4 4 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next stitch 3 times 18 stitches 5 change to light yarn leave a good long tail of red 18 single_crochet around 6 8 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next stitch twice 20 stitches 7 20 single_crochet all round 8 repeat round 7 9 9 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next stitch twice 22 stitches 10 22 single_crochet all round 11 repeat round 10 12 chain 1 8 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next stitch 10 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in next stitch 1 half_double_crochet 1 single_crochet join to initial chain with slip_stitch 24 stitches 13 working through the front posts of each stitch in round 12 as shown in picture above 24 slip_stitch then use a slip_stitch to return to the top of the stitches from round 12 14 work through the tops of the stitches in round 12 7 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next st 3 times 27 stitches 15 27 single_crochet all round turn the work inside out so you have a cup with the right side on the inside continue stitching in the same direction i e working now backwards from the inside of the cup as you work the rim 16 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in next stitch 9 times 36 stitches 17 36 single_crochet all round 18 4 single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet over next 2 st 6 times 30 stitches 19 30 single_crochet all round turn the last few row over to make the rim of the cup so that the row you are about to work round 20 lines up with the backs of the slip stitches you made back in round 13 now in round 20 every 2-3 stitches when you insert hook through top of the round 19 stitches pick up one loop from the back of the slip stitches this will secure the rim in place as shown in fig 2 right 20 3 single_crochet 1 decrease single_crochet over next 2 st 6 times
